terms.term: A set of local changes that you haven't committed to a VCS yet. All changes to project files are automatically placed in the active changelist (normally, the Default changelist).
A context is a set of opened files associated with a changelist.
To mark a branch as a favorite, hover the mouse cursor over the branch name and click the star next to it.
A detached HEAD means a specific commit is checked out instead of a branch.
A double quoted string that contains a Groovy expression with the ${expression} syntax.
Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTP over TLS/SSL)
The main Java compiler that converts source code into JVM bytecode (included in the JDK).
Java Development Kit: a software package that contains libraries and tools for developing and testing Java applications, and for running applications on the Java platform.
Java Runtime Environment: a software package that contains libraries and tools for running applications on the Java platform.
Java Virtual Machine: a virtual machine that executes Java bytecode (included in the JDK).
Read-eval-print loop, also known as a language shell, is a simple programming environment that evaluates user input and returns the result.
Local changes that have not been committed yet.
SQL file that is already connected to a data source.
Area of %product% where you write and edit your code.
